conclusion: The graph shows that the acceleration \( a \) is given by \( a = \frac{3t_0}{2} \).
The velocity \( v \) is given by \( v = a \cdot t_0 \).
The velocity at different times is calculated: At \( t = 0 \), \( v = a_0 t_0 \). At \( t = t_0 \), \( v = a_0 t_0 \). At \( t = 2t_0 \), \( v = a_0 t_0 \).
The particle is farthest from the starting point when its velocity is zero. From the velocity law, this occurs at \( t = 2t_0 \).
The reasoning is verified by checking the velocity graph. The particle's velocity is zero at \( t = 2t_0 \), confirming it is farthest from the starting point.
The particle is farthest from the starting point at \( t = 2t_0 \).
